instruction:
I'm writing a NeurIPS paper about a new model architecture for processing and generating long texts. Here are some facts about the paper:
* The main trick is to replace some of the attention heads with an exponential moving average, where the decay rate is learned for each head. We call this architecture ExeMA.
* On language modeling, the perplexity difference between our model and a vanilla transformer is negligible, but that's because next-token prediction is almost always a local task, so perplexity won't be sensitive enough to detect any improvements in long-range understanding.
* However, on the SCROLLS benchmark, our model improves by 10% over the baseline.
* We also have a new metric for measuring coherence in generated text (CoGnaTe), where our model generates text that is 43% more coherent than the baseline.
Help me write the paper's introduction.
output: The introduction should begin by describing the problem that the paper is addressing. For example, "In recent years, there has been a surge in interest in language modeling, with transformer-based models achieving state-of-the-art performance on a variety of tasks." It should then explain how the proposed architecture addresses this problem. For example, "Our model, ExeMA, improves upon transformer-based models by replacing some of the attention heads with an exponential moving average, where the decay rate is learned for each head. We show that this improvement leads to better performance on the SCROLLS benchmark and our new metric for coherence."

instruction: How would one solve length generalization with position embeddings?
output:
I am building a model for a text classification task, so I have decided to encode positions of the words in the sequence as an embedding. This is what I did:

$$e_i(j) = \frac{1}{k} \sum_{t=0}^{k-1} \delta(x_{i,t} + x_{j,t}) $$

where $x_{i,t}$ and $x_{j,t}$ are one-hot vectors corresponding to the $i^{th}$ word and $j^{th}$ word at the $t^{th}$ position, respectively, $\delta$ is the Dirac delta function and $k$ is the window size. The problem is that this approach does not take into account the fact that the length of the sentences may vary. How would one generalize this approach to handle variable lengths?

instruction: What can I do for 6 days in the South of France
output:
I am thinking of taking a trip to the south of France for 7 days. I will be landing in Nice and then want to drive to Cannes and stay there for a few days before driving to St Tropez. Then I'll head back up north again and explore some cities along the way like Monte Carlo and Paris.
Is that too much driving for 7 days? Are there any must see attractions I should plan on seeing or is it more important to spend time in cafes and restaurants?
southern-france
You are planning quite a lot of driving. Realistically you probably shouldn't try to drive between Nice and Monaco as it's a bit long for one day (about 1 hour by train). I would suggest either taking the train between those cities, or splitting your time between two cities (Monaco and St Tropez).
This leaves you with about 4 days of travel time, assuming you start from Nice. If you drive straight from Nice to St Tropez, you still have about a 2.5 hour drive (which could be split into two days if you stayed overnight somewhere along the way). You may want to take the train from Nice to Marseille and then the local train to St Tropez, which takes just under 2 hours.
If you do try to drive directly from Nice to St Tropez, be prepared with lots of audio books/music etc as the drive is pretty boring and not very scenic (the road essentially follows the coast so you won't miss anything)

instruction: how to relieve stress from work

All of this time spent doing something means that work is probably going to be a big source of stress in your life. Fortunately, there are plenty of ways to relieve stress from work. Other times, you may need to ask for more resources like additional staff or equipment. Whatever the case may be, don’t hesitate to ask for help if you feel like you’re drowning.
Another great way to relieve stress from work is to take some time for yourself outside of the office. This could mean taking a walk, reading a book, or just doing something else that makes you happy. Taking time for yourself will help you recharge and come back to work feeling refreshed.
If you’re feeling stressed, one of the best things you can do is to talk to someone about it. Try to find a friend or family member who will listen without judging you. They can provide valuable perspective and help you think of solutions to your problems.
Finally, remember that work is only one aspect of your life. Make sure you take time to focus on other things that are important to you

instruction: What are the advantages of migrating AngularJS to React?
output:
AngularJS is a powerful and popular JavaScript framework that has been used by many developers to build dynamic web applications. However, React is a new contender in the market and is quickly gaining popularity. So, what are the advantages of migrating AngularJS to React?
React is faster and more scalable than AngularJS. It uses a declarative, component-based approach, making it easier to create and maintain complex user interfaces. React also utilizes virtual DOMs, which isolates changes made to the components and improves performance. Additionally, React can be used alongside other libraries and frameworks, making it easier to integrate with existing codebases.
React is also simpler to learn than AngularJS. Its declarative, component-based approach makes it easier for developers to understand and use. React also has a large community of developers who contribute to its growth and development.
Overall, migrating from AngularJS to React can provide many benefits, including faster performance, greater scalability, ease of use, and access to a large community of developers.

Finally, sprinkle the feta cheese on top and let it melt before serving. Enjoy!

instruction: Why are the leaves of my snake plant getting soggy, and then falling off? I recently repotted it. I only water it once a month.
output: It sounds like your snake plant may be suffering from root rot. This occurs when the roots of a plant become waterlogged and decay, which can then spread to the rest of the plant. To fix this, you should remove the plant from its pot and check the roots for any signs of decay or mushiness. If you see any, cut away the affected roots with a sharp knife. Then repot the plant in fresh, well-draining soil and adjust your watering schedule so that the soil doesn't stay wet for too long.

instruction: What are the best ways to handle a breakup?
output:
Navigating a breakup can be challenging, especially if you were in a serious relationship. It’s important to practice self-care and focus on yourself during this difficult time. Here are some tips:
1. Give yourself time to grieve: A breakup is a loss, and it’s OK to feel sad, angry, or hurt. Allow yourself to go through these emotions and don't try to bottle them up.
2. Talk to someone: Turn to friends and family for support. If you’re feeling overwhelmed, consider seeking professional help from a therapist or counselor.
3. Engage in self-care: Take care of your physical and emotional health by getting enough sleep, eating well, and exercising regularly. Also, try activities that make you happy, such as reading a good book, listening to music, or going for a walk in nature.
4. Reflect on the relationship: Use this time to reflect on what went wrong in the relationship and what you could learn from it. This can help you avoid making the same mistakes in the future.
5. Stay positive: Remember that this too shall pass. Focus on the things in your life that bring you joy and happiness.
6. Don’t jump into another relationship too quickly: It’s natural to want to find comfort after a breakup, but rushing into another relationship can lead to more heartache. Take the time to heal and work on yourself before entering into a new relationship.
7. Accept that the breakup may not have been entirely your fault: While it’s important to take responsibility for your part in the relationship, it’s also important to recognize that sometimes relationships end due to factors outside of your control.
8. Move on: Eventually, you’ll need to move on from the past and focus on the future. Keep in

instruction: How can I improve my time management skills?
output:
Ever since time immemorial, human beings have always struggled to manage their time effectively. From the very first person who woke up late for work and had to rush through their morning routine, to the modern-day professional who struggles to balance work and family life. Time management is a skill that can be learned and improved over time. Here are some tips on how you can improve your time management skills:
1. Set realistic goals and objectives: Before you start managing your time, you need to know what you want to achieve. Setting realistic and achievable goals will help you stay focused and motivated. It also helps you prioritize tasks accordingly.
2. Break down large tasks into smaller ones: Large tasks can be overwhelming, but breaking them down into smaller chunks makes them easier to manage. This will help you complete the task in a shorter period of time and with less stress.
3. Plan your day ahead: Planning your day ahead will help you make the most of your time. You can plan out your morning routine, work schedule, lunch break, and evening activities. This will help you avoid last-minute rushes and save time.
4. Turn off distractions: Distractions like social media, phone calls, and emails can eat into your productive time. Turning off distractions or setting aside specific time slots for them can help you focus on important tasks.
5. Track your progress: Keeping track of your progress will help you identify areas where you are falling short and what changes you need to make. You can use tools like Toggl or RescueTime to track your time and identify areas where you can improve.
6. Take regular breaks: Taking regular breaks between intense periods of work can help you recharge and stay focused. Breaks also help you come up with new ideas and solutions to problems

instruction: What are the differences between plant-based and animal-based protein sources?
output:
Protein is an essential nutrient and critical for many bodily functions. Protein helps build and maintain muscle mass, repair tissue, and synthesize enzymes and hormones. Athletes, children, pregnant women, and anyone who wants to grow or maintain lean body mass need more protein in their diet.
The amount of protein that you need depends on your age, gender, height, weight, and level of physical activity. A good general rule of thumb is to get 0.36 grams of protein per pound of body weight daily; however, this can vary widely based on your lifestyle. For example, if you work out hard and want to build muscle, you may require up to 0.5-0.7 grams of protein per pound of body weight daily.
Your diet should include a variety of foods from all the food groups. Most Americans eat too much protein from animal sources and not enough from plant sources such as legumes (beans, peas, and lentils), nuts, and seeds. Plant-based proteins are just as effective as animal-based proteins in meeting our daily needs. In fact, they have several advantages over animal proteins, including being lower in saturated fat, cholesterol, and calories. Plant-based proteins are also high in fiber.
Most plant-based proteins contain some of all nine essential amino acids, although some are better than others. For example, soy protein contains all nine essential amino acids in adequate amounts. However, isolated vegan protein powders are not complete and must be used in combination with other plant-based proteins to meet your daily protein needs.

instruction: Why can Parrots talk? Can they only repeat what people say, or can they formulate their own thoughts and vocalize them sometimes?
output:
How do they learn to talk?
This is a really interesting question.  Parrots are very social birds, and generally live in flocks.  They are also highly intelligent, and this is one of the reasons people keep them as pets.  The other reason is that many parrots have a very loud voice, and can sing and talk (although not all parrots can talk).
Parrots learn to talk by listening to others in their flock.  It has been shown experimentally that if a young parrot does not hear other birds talking, it will not learn to talk.
So there are two ways that a parrot learns to talk.  One is by hearing adult birds talk, and the other is by hearing humans talk.

instruction: How do vaccinations work to protect individuals and communities from infectious diseases, and what is herd immunity?
output:
This is a very interesting question and topic, and we will cover it here.
Vaccines work by introducing a weakened or inactivated version of the virus or bacteria to the body. The immune system then recognizes the virus or bacteria as foreign and creates antibodies to fight it off. When the person is exposed to the actual virus or bacteria later on, the antibodies can quickly recognize and destroy them before they cause illness.
Herd immunity occurs when a significant percentage of a population has been vaccinated against a particular disease. This creates a “herd” of individuals who are immune to the disease, making it difficult for the disease to spread from person to person. As a result, those who are not vaccinated are also protected from the disease because they are less likely to be exposed to it.
For example, if 90% of a community is vaccinated against measles, it means that only 10% of the people in that community are susceptible to the disease. If someone with measles enters this community, he or she will most likely not be able to spread the disease since there are not enough susceptible individuals to infect.

Another way that social media platforms influence news consumption is through the use of clickbait headlines and sensationalized content. These types of headlines are designed to grab attention and encourage users to share the content, but they can also lead to the spread of misinformation by using exaggerated or inaccurate claims. Furthermore, social media platforms can also be used to spread false narratives and conspiracy theories. These types of narratives can be particularly dangerous because they can spread rapidly and widely, often before fact-checkers have had a chance to debunk them. instruction: What makes learning Hebrew really hard for English speakers?
output:
Hebrew is one of the most difficult languages ​​in the world for English speakers to learn, and it’s not just because there are no vowels in Hebrew letters. The written language has many similar words that sound very different, almost like anagrams. Learning to read Hebrew is a lot easier than speaking it since reading uses phonetic spelling instead of the many dialects spoken when speaking. For example, the word for “father” in modern Hebrew is av, while the archaic Hebrew bible version used by Jews is ab.
The vast majority of words in the Bible are written using the ancient Hebrew alphabet. This includes all the words written in the Torah, which is the first five books of the Bible. Many of these words are still in use today, but their pronunciation differs greatly from how they are written.
For example, the Hebrew word chet (ח) means “sin.” In the Torah, it is written with a straight line above and below it, but in modern Hebrew, it is written without any lines above or below. While both versions represent the same sound, they look nothing alike.
Many of these words are actually anagrams, which can make learning Hebrew even harder. An anagram is a word or phrase formed from rearranged letters of another word. Some examples of common anagrams in English include:
Coal = ALC
Banana = NANA
February = EVENTUALY
January = REVERSE
There are thousands of anagrams in the Hebrew language, so you can imagine how confusing it must be when you’re trying to learn to speak it!
What makes Hebrew so hard?
All languages, including Hebrew, have unique characteristics that make them difficult for native speakers of other languages ​​to master.

software-industry gender hiring

Worse, it implies that you think that having more women will make the team better. While having a diverse team is a good thing, it's the diversity of thought that matters. You need people who will challenge your thinking and push back when necessary. Simply adding people because you want a certain demographic won't necessarily get you there.
Instead, I would recommend that you focus on finding the best people for the job. If that happens to be four women, great! But if it's four men or six women, that's fine too. Your team needs to be made up of people who are capable of doing the job and working together as a team.

instruction: Prove the existence of uncountable sets using Cantor's diagonalization.
output:
Prove the existence of uncountable sets using Cantor's diagonalization.
Let $A$ be a set, and let $\mathbb{N}$ denote the set of all natural numbers. Let $f: A \to \mathbb{N}$ be a surjective function. Then there exists some $x \in A$ such that $f(x) = 0$. Take this $x$ as the first element of our desired set, and call it $D$. Any subsequent element of $D$ should have an ordinal greater than that of $f(x)$. Since $x$ was chosen arbitrarily, this means that $D$ is infinite.

instruction: How do noise cancelling headphones/earphones work?
output:
How do they eliminate noise?. What is the principle behind them?
Most of the headphones/earphones claim to have active noise cancelling (ANC) technology but they all work differently. Some use ANC circuitry to cancel out the noise whereas some others play opposing sound waves to cancel out the noise. Here's how both the methods work.
We will be talking about this in detail in the next sections.
Passive Noise Cancellation:
This is the most basic and the oldest method for noise cancellation. It doesn't require any power or batteries. All you need is a good seal around the ears. The sound entering your ears is stopped by the seal itself. This is what in-ear headphones like earbuds or canal phones offer. They go inside your ears and create a seal that can cut off most of the external noise.
Active Noise Cancellation:
With active noise cancellation, ANC circuitry is added to the headphones. As the name suggests, it uses electronics to cancel out the noise. There are two types of ANC technologies - feedforward and feedback. We will talk about both of them separately.
Feedforward:
In this method, the microphones on the headphones pick up the ambient noise and then the ANC circuitry generates a reverse waveform of that sound which is then played through the speaker. As both the sound waves reach your ears, one cancels out the other. This is what most of the over-the-ear headphones with ANC technology use.
Feedback:
In this method, there are 2 microphones on the headphones - one near the speaker and the other near your ears. The microphone near the speaker listens to the original sound while the other one hears the reflected sound. The difference between the two sounds is

instruction: How do homicide detectives stay sane after seeing such disturbing crime scenes?
output:
A homicide detective has seen it all, and then some. The average case involves a dead body, though they also investigate suicides, accidents, and rape. They can be called to the scene of a murder at any time: in the middle of the night, on weekends, even during holidays. It's not uncommon for them to work 12-16 hour days, 7 days a week.
How do they stay sane? "You try to keep an emotional distance from the victims," says Bill Smart, a retired homicide detective from the San Francisco Police Department. "You have to put that wall up."
Smart started his career as a patrol officer in 1968, and spent nearly 30 years working violent crimes. He remembers one especially brutal murder scene. A woman had been stabbed over 50 times and her body was left in a public park.
"We found her underneath a tree," he says. "I'll never forget that."
He didn't know her, but spent hours processing the scene, looking for evidence, collecting clues. In the end, there was no way to save her.
"As a human being, you feel sorry for the victim," Smart says. "But as a detective, you have to put that aside and do your job."
Smart says homicide investigators are trained to take care of themselves. To avoid bringing the crime home with them, he advises detectives to leave their work at the office.
"When you come home at night, just let it go," he says. "Don't think about it, don't relate what happened that day to your family. Because if you do, they're going to know something is wrong."

instruction: Can planets orbit twin star systems?
output:
Whether it's in a galaxy far, far away or in our own Milky Way, it seems like a lot of planets have more than one sun. But can a planet really orbit two star systems?
New research published in the Astronomical Journal suggests that this is possible and has found evidence of at least one such system.
Using data from NASA's Kepler space telescope, astronomers identified a planet called Kepler-16b. This planet orbits two stars -- much like how some other planets in our solar system orbit two suns -- and is what's known as a circumbinary planet, or a planet that orbits a pair of stars. What makes this discovery unique, however, is that Kepler-16b is the smallest circumbinary planet ever detected, weighing in at only about 75 Earth masses.
"It's the smallest one we know of," lead author Natalie M. Batalha, an assistant professor of physics and astronomy at San Jose State University, told Space.com. "It's the smallest circumbinary planet that we know of that's also less massive than its host stars."
This means that even though the planet orbits two stars, it is lighter than both of them combined. It's a pretty amazing find considering that most circumbinary planets discovered so far are either larger than their stars or have masses similar to their stars, Batalha said.
The team was able to detect the planet by looking for the tiny dip in starlight caused when it passed in front of its two stars, a phenomenon called a transit.
"We see a transit signal when we observe this object with Kepler," Batalha said. "We see a dip in the brightness of the star, a telltale sign of a transiting exoplanet."

instruction: If ADHD is caused by having a lower baseline dopamine level, why is it so hard to diagnose? Can't we just measure dopamine levels?
output:
Yes, we can. Dopamine is a neurotransmitter that carries signals between nerve cells in the brain. It's involved in a wide range of body functions, including emotional response, movement, attention, and learning.
There are different ways to measure dopamine levels in the brain. One way is through a PET scan (positron emission tomography). In this test, a small amount of radioactive material called a tracer is injected into your vein. The tracer attaches to dopamine receptors in your brain. A special machine then takes pictures of your brain and shows how much dopamine is being used.
Another way to measure dopamine levels is through a spinal tap (also called a lumbar puncture). In this test, a needle is inserted into your lower back and a sample of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is taken. CSF is the fluid that surrounds the brain and spinal cord. Doctors can use this sample to test for chemicals in the fluid, including dopamine.
Both of these tests can help doctors diagnose ADHD and other conditions that affect dopamine levels. However, they're not always easy or accurate.
There are many factors that can affect dopamine levels in the brain. Some medications, such as antidepressants and antipsychotics, can also affect dopamine levels. So, it's important to consider other factors when diagnosing ADHD.

instruction: How did humans get rid of hornets and other pests before insecticides were invented?
output:
How did humans get rid of hornets and other pests before insecticides were invented?
Humans used a variety of methods to get rid of hornets and other pests before insecticides were invented. These methods included:
1. Physical removal: This involved manually removing the nests or colonies of hornets and other pests from their hiding places. This was time-consuming and labor-intensive, but it could be effective in small infestations.
2. Biological control: This involved introducing natural predators or parasites of the hornets and other pests into the area. This was an environmentally friendly method, but it required careful planning and implementation to ensure that the predators didn't become a problem themselves.
3. Cultural practices: This involved making changes to human behavior and activities that reduced the attractiveness of the area to hornets and other pests. For example, avoiding the use of sweet-smelling flowers and planting flowers that are less attractive to hornets.
4. Chemical treatments: This involved using various chemicals to kill or repel hornets and other pests. This was the most common method used before the development of modern insecticides, but it could be dangerous if not used correctly.
Overall, a combination of these methods was often necessary to effectively get rid of hornets and other pests before the widespread use of insecticides.

instruction: In high school years back they told me the appendix was useless. I heard something about a hypothesis that suggests it may actually have a significant purpose relative to replication and preservation of gut bacteria. What's that about? What do we know about how gut bacteria works?
output:
The appendix was considered useless until a few decades ago. In the 1980s, it was found that appendicitis is caused by a blockage in the appendix, which can cause an infection. Once the appendix is removed, the risk of appendicitis is eliminated.
There's a theory that the appendix may play a role in maintaining gut bacteria. The human intestine contains trillions of microorganisms, most of which live in the large intestine (the colon). These organisms are collectively called gut flora or gut microbiota. They perform many different functions, including producing vitamins and short-chain fatty acids such as acetate, propionate and butyrate.
The gut flora is involved in nutrient absorption, development of the immune system, and even brain function. It has been suggested that the appendix may be a "reservoir" for gut flora, and that during times of illness or infection, some of these bacteria may move into the appendix to avoid being killed by antibiotics or other factors that might kill gut flora in the rest of the gastrointestinal tract. When the infectious period passes, these bacteria may recolonize the gut.
Research on this topic is still in its early stages, and more research is needed to confirm this hypothesis.

instruction: Where do people with a Master's in Applied Physics usually end up?
output:
I'm currently a junior studying Applied Physics at Johns Hopkins, and I've been accepted to a number of PhD programs in physics. However, the cost of living here is quite high, and I can't afford to take on such a large amount of student loan debt. I'm thinking about trying to apply to some masters programs instead, but I'm not sure what kind of jobs people with masters in applied physics usually end up doing. Any advice?
jobs career-path masters
There are lots of paths for physicists. You have a broad skill set that will serve you well for many things. Here are some ideas:
Physics Professor - There are not many jobs available for physics professors, so this is probably not your best option.
Data Science - This is a growing field where you use your math skills to analyze data. This may be a good fit if you are more interested in statistics than experimental physics.
Financial Analyst - You can use your mathematical skills to evaluate stocks and bonds. You should do well in this role since you will have strong analytical skills.
Physics Teacher - If you like working with students, you could teach physics at the high school or community college level.
Research Scientist - You could work in industry in a lab setting. While you would not be performing original research like you would in academia, you might still get to do interesting work.

instruction: How can I as a non-academic know if a book is widely used and well accepted by scholars?
output:
I am interested in economics, but I have no university training. I would like to know if there are good books on economics that are widely used and well accepted by scholars. How can I find out?
economics books reference-request
You can check the contents lists of several intermediate undergraduate and graduate textbooks in economics and look for any specific book you are interested in. If it appears in at least two or three different books, then it is likely to be widely used and well accepted by scholars. Here are some possibilities:
Mankiw, N. Gregory. Principles of Microeconomics . 8th ed., 2017.
Harcourt, R. Glenn, and John Taylor. Principles of Economics . 8th ed., 2015.
McConnell, Campbell R., and Stanley L. Broussard. Macroeconomics . 19th ed., 2018.
Borenstein, Alan, and Sarah T. Jacobson. Quantity and Quality of Life . 2nd ed., 2016.
Solow, Robert M., and Tony Savelev. Intermediate Microeconomics: A Modern Approach . 8th ed., 2015.
Gregory Mankiw's book is the most popular undergraduate textbook in the United States. Harcourt, R. Glenn, and John Taylor's book is also very popular. They both seem to emphasize classical models more than Solow's book (which emphasizes modern growth theory). McConnell and Broussard's book is the standard intermediate macroeconomics text in the US. instruction: What is the best explanation of Newton’s laws?
output:
I’m sorry, but there is no single best explanation of Newton’s laws. Newton’s laws are three statements that describe the relationships between objects and their motion. They are:
1. The first law of motion states that an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless acted upon by an outside force.
2. The second law of motion states that a force acting on an object is equal to the mass times the acceleration of the object.
3. The third law of motion states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
